input: What does Section 65 of the IPC define?
target: Section 65 limits imprisonment in default of fine to one-fourth of the maximum imprisonment for the offense.

input: Can imprisonment under Section 65 exceed the maximum term for the offense?
target: No, imprisonment in default of fine cannot exceed one-fourth of the maximum term for the offense.

input: Does Section 65 apply to all fines?
target: Yes, Section 65 applies to all fines if imprisonment in default is imposed.

input: What is the purpose of Section 65 in the IPC?
target: Section 65 ensures proportionality between the default imprisonment and the original punishment.

input: What is an example of Section 65 in action?
target: If the maximum imprisonment for an offense is 4 years, default imprisonment cannot exceed 1 year.
